job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Moscow, ID
pros: Awesome hospital and great staff to work with

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Moscow, ID
pros: They will hire just about anyone, so if you need a job right away it shouldn't be too hard. Many of your coworkers will be friendly and helpful, people work together well as a team.
cons: The management is subpar, they dont manage conflict between employees or between patients and staff. If a patient is volient or aggressive, nothing is done to ensure your saftey. The compensation is poor, many full time employees using the hospitals insurance plan still qualify for financial assistance for their medical bills due to the low pay. Overtime is not only frequent but encourgaed for most, if not all, employees. You will find yourself working more and still making less. Managerial decisions on workflows often result in poor patient care, creating upset patients that you will have to deal with. Chronic understaffing and high turnover create a work environment where you will have to do more than your job description. There are problems with racism and transphobia with the staff that management refuses to address.
High turn over, minimal time off and toxic leadership.

job_title: Medical Biller Specialist in Moscow, ID
pros: community driven, friendly staff all around

review_title: Admin will never care about you.
job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Moscow, ID
pros: The staff you work directly with are wonderful. The Emergency Department Director is also wonderful. But the CNO, CEO will only ever offer free pizza during hard times. They will never come in to sit psych during critical staffing shortages, and they also kept their full salaries and bonuses during COVID while EVERY SINGLE EMPLOYEE was denied overtime pay while simultaneously being required to work overtime. There are hospitals just over the border with a far higher employee retention rate... for a reason
cons: lack of support in every way possible.

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Moscow, ID
pros: No pay for performance - so time was allowed to be spent as needed.
cons: Seven weeks of call per year without pay.

pros: Team atmosphere, supportive leaders and administration.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement

pros: This place is so disorganized. I’m not sure how it works in other areas of the company but those of us in the clinics have no decent leadership.
cons: Poor leadership. Embarrassing that supervisors dont know how to do their job. Ive heard from other staff this has been ongoing for the last 2 years.

pros: Amazing co-workers and collaboration of direct care departments.

pros: Wonderful rural hospital that does a lot for the community

pros: Work assignment pay and life balance

I was only there for a short time since I was filling in for someone on leave, but it was really a nice place to work. The management seemed to care about employees, everyone was generally polite and helpful, and things were accomplished.
cons: I had one coworker who was a little less than helpful and polite, but that happens everywhere. This person was an exception to the rule. The only other thing that was a little irritating was some of the corporate speak, if you will. But it wasn't egregious and comes with the territory of being a larger business/entity.

review_title: Gritman Medical Center good place to get experience
job_title: Materials Management Tech II in Moscow, ID
pros: A lot of Gritman Employees are wonderful to work with, and make the job fun. The Administration is good at giving credit to employees and will send you Thank You Letters for the work you put in. They are lots of employee appreciation rewards and gifts. Gritman benefits are good as well.
cons: Doctor can pull a lot of weight, so if there is a process that will make things easier for staff and they don't like it they will be catered to over others.

pros: The pay was fair.The HR Director is great!
cons: The CNO is nearing retirement and could not or did not want to make decisions. Many of the staff only care about themselves - very little dedication to the organization.Grow up Children!

job_title: Admitting Service Representative in Moscow, ID
pros: Great Community and Benefits. They really care for you as an employee
cons: Understaffed.  IN the two departments I have work for, we were constantly understaffed and stretched thin

pros: Great place to work and they really care for their employees. Ideas and suggestions are heard and employee satisfaction is taken very seriously.
